You wake up on Medical beds, then stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

n
The dark cave
  Entering the dark cave, an overwhelming feeling of dread and despair fills 
your being. Smells of rotten decay waft up from below with sounds that pierce
your being and make the hairs on your neck stand on end. You wonder if this 
adventure is really worth the rewards after hearing tales in the village 
about an eight-armed skeleton who stole a woman only two days ago. Maybe it 
was just the peasant's imagination working during the excitement of the 
moment. Looking around to make sure it's safe to go down, you notice 
something scrawled on the wall.

[ Exits: south down ]

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Dropping down through the hole above you, you find yourself standing in a 
twisting passageway of stone. Red eyes glowing in the darkness gleam at you 
and the shuffling sounds of something moving nearer reaches your ears.
Quickly lighting a torch you hold it up, gasping with fear as you take a step
back as undead move forward. So many of them, so many different kinds, your 
mind races... How can this be that they are all working together like this?
Your question will have to wait...

[ Exits: north east west up down ]

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Finally emerging past the rows of caverns, you find yourself still traveling 
through the rough stone passageways. Curving to the east you see a light up 
ahead in what appears to be a much larger cavern. If there is light perhaps 
there is help, or at least maybe no undead to contend with. Maybe the priests
are not the only ones here trying to help.

through the rough stone passageways. Curving to the east you see a light up

e
A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Finally emerging past the rows of caverns, you find yourself still traveling 
through the rough stone passageways. Curving to the west, you see a light up 
ahead in what appears to be a much larger cavern. If there is light perhaps 
there is help, or at least maybe no undead to contend with. Maybe the priests
are not the only ones here trying to help.

e
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Moving forward you find yourself standing in a hallway of sorts. Close by to 
the north you can make out doorways leading to either side of the hallway 
while farther on you think you can barely see the outline of a door. Maybe 
there is something behind that door that can help you figure out what's going
on around here. As you ponder the thoughts you're having you hear a faint 
scratching noise coming from above you. Looking up you jump back in surprise 
as you narrowly escape the clawing blow of some strange creature climbing 
along the walls!

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

nails.

n
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Standing outside what appears to be doorways on either side of you, you 
struggle to see into either room, but the twisting rock curves around, 
keeping you from seeing what awaits in them. Strangely enough you think you 
see a dim glow of light coming from the west room, while the east room 
remains completely black. Looking down you notice a thin trail of blood 
running along the floor and leading into the west room...

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Red Aura) An insane-looking, green-skinned, bald man sits here gnawing on a bone.
(Red Aura) A skeleton rattles as it runs screaming for you!

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Drawing closer, you are positive you can see a door at the end of this 
passageway now. It seems as though it only grows darker the closer you get.
Holding your hand up in front of your face, you make sure this really is 
real. As the light flickers around your skin, so warm and full of life, you 
shudder at the thought of what it must be like to die or become trapped in a 
place of such everlasting cold and darkness...

e
Before the door
  Standing before the door you can see faint traces of light coming from around
its edges, and you can just barely make out what sounds like a boiling noise 
coming from inside. Pushing against the door you find it locked. Taking a 
mighty swing with your axe results in a chipped blade. This door is protected
by some sort of powerful magic enchantment. You wonder what it will take to 
break this spell so you can find out what's going on inside...

[ Exits: (north) east south west up ]
(Hidden) (Translucent) (Red Aura) A nasty-looking grey-skinned man stands here with filth-encrusted
nails.
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A filthy grey-skinned creature glows slightly as it runs about the room.

>>    A rough hewn passageway of stone

magics! Apparently you are not the only one here trying to help out the poor 
people of Dortmund. One of the priests sees you enter the room, "Don't just 
stand there- help hold this thing down, for crying out loud!"

1195/2282 HP  665/2887 MP  2001/2010 mv  346tnl  
Lv 101  G 2039983 | A rough hewn passageway of stone (NESWUD)
>>    
e
A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

[ Exits: east west (down) ]
(Red Aura) A slow moving figure covered in wounds stands here.

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Standing outside what appears to be doorways on either side of you, you 
struggle to see into either room, but the twisting rock curves around, 
keeping you from seeing what awaits in them. Strangely enough you think you 
see a dim glow of light coming from the west room, while the east room 
remains completely black. Looking down you notice a thin trail of blood 
running along the floor and leading into the west room...

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Red Aura) A skeleton rattles as it runs screaming for you!
(Red Aura) An insane-looking, green-skinned, bald man sits here gnawing on a bone.
Skeleton hisses at you!

1231/2282 HP  709/2887 MP  2007/2010 mv  346tnl  
Lv 101  G 2039983 | A rough hewn passageway of stone (NESWUD)
w
>>    
A dimly lit room
  A small man and woman sit here at a table; a single candle flickers and burns
on a small stand to one side. Grinning, the man rises and greets you.
"Hello, I'm Randall Fen-rir Get and this is my wife Tikki." Lowering his 
voice to a low snarl, he gestures to the table. "Care to join us for a 
feast?" Raising your torch lets you see that a human hand rests on the plate 
before him, while his wife Tikki calmly rips another bite from the forearm 
she holds...

[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) A skeleton rattles as it runs screaming for you!
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A filthy grey-skinned creature glows slightly as it runs about the room.
(Golden Aura) An elven warrior kneels here, blood flowing from a heavy gash.
A pretty young woman sits here having a meal with her husband.
A handsome man sits here having a meal with his wife.
Skeleton hisses at you!

A cavern
  This cavern seems to be some sort of refuse dump for body parts and personal 
belongings. Apparently there must be someone else around here to use this 
cavern as a waste room; certainly the undead would not care about such 
things. As you wonder about this discovery you sense some movement coming 
from the heaps of rotting flesh and clothing. Bracing yourself, you watch 
cautiously for the source. Suddenly you are showered by clumps of rot as a 
huge bulbous creature emerges, waving two tentacled arms about. It gnashes 
its teeth in a grotesque central maw as its single eye darts back and forth 
seemingly to keep you in its field of vision.

[ Exits: east ]
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A black shadow slides around the room here.
(Red Aura) (Angry) A slow moving figure covered in wounds stands here.
A fat, slobbering creature waves two long tentacles around in the air.

Zombie is in perfect health.

A rough hewn passageway of stone

what appears to be more cavern entrances. A high pitched shriek rings out and

hilt of his sword. Blood runs freely from a nasty wound in his side. Looking 
up he motions you closer, "Please I beg of you, HELP THEM!"

w
A cavern
  Running into the room, you see a band of elven warriors standing together in 
a tight formation. Shields and swords drawn, they are facing a huge beast.
It appears to be some form of bear, but it has to be undead. Its ribcage 
shows exposed bone gleaming whitely in the torch light, and numerous other 
pieces of it seem to have just fallen off. The elves are obviously 
well-trained, and they move forward in unison attacking the beast 
ferociously, hacking lumps of flesh from its body. It roars in frustration 
and, seemingly unaffected, it charges!

1675/2318 HP  196/3009 MP  2031/1986 mv  880tnl  
Lv 102  G 2062520 | A cavern (E)
>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Felwyne the Priest.
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (Linkdead) Relek of the past!.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve 10 is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

You return to the living world.

You can no longer sense anger.

There is a loud scream and a flare of light shoots towards the sky.
Below the flare, you hear Myrddin scream 'HEAR ME, FOR I HAVE CONQUERED!'
As the light fades you realize a new superhero has been born.
For the next 15 minutes experience is doubled in honor of the new superhero.

The Gunfire and Training cease for a moment as the Boot Hall is Restored.

The scent of napalm fades from your nostrils.

Your force shield shimmers then fades away.
Your skin feels soft again.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A misty path (G)
  You stumble onto a small path that winds its way through the mists.  All
around you the echo of tiny laughter slowly fades away.  Small hands reach
out from the mist all about you and pinch you.  

[ Exits: north south ]

>>    The Gingerbread House
  A small gingerbread house sits in front of you, looking good enough to
eat!  Glazed sugar windows reflect back at you, framed by candy canes.

charming, hard-candy door.

onwards.  You can hear the chirping of crickets and the croaking of frogs

squishes as you look for a path out.

you should lay off the late night cheese platter.

A Misty Path (G)
  You step into another world, all lush forest and dense undergrowth.  A
path winds through the forest, heavy mist coiling about your feet as you
walk.  There are sounds and whispers from the undergrowth, fading away
whenever you turn to face them.

>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Huldra Forest (1968)

A dark forest
  Wandering through the forest was a bad idea. Not only is it cold and wet, but
also unnaturally dark. Regardless of the time of day, the forest stays the 
same brightness. Even the sounds of the forest have been muffled by some 
unseen force. The remains of an animal trail loop and twist around, 
eventually extending out of sight.

The yellow tent
  This is, by far, the most modest and smallest tent in the camp. The tent 
itself seems to have been thrown up in an unreasonable amount of haste.
Papers line the south, north, and western walls of the tent, some of which
have official stamps, signatures, or nothing at all Without any semblance of 
order, or of chaos, the sheer number of documents seems overwhelming for a 
single person, let alone a single kobold. The chaos to the west of kobolds 
training in combat is almost welcoming compared to the discord found within 
this yellow tent.

[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) The kobolds' recruiter, Sergeant Bifzot, is trying to sign you up.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Edge of the Nenukon (G)
  You stand at the edge of the Nenukon. A dark and twisted region of the world.
Deep within lies what is said to be the ultimate evil, and also the resting 
place of the only thing that can stop it. Beyond the Nenukon is said to be 
the Empire of The Far Country, a land of warriors, where the governing tribes
themselves are in a constant state of war.

Monuhi's Crypt! [**> PK <**]
  Welcome to your grave. Monuhi is older than time itself, any mortal who 
wishes to defeat him should have more power than they know what to do with, 
and even then some more. Many have come to challenge the master of evil, to 
this day, only one has succeeded. He was unable to kill Monuhi though, and 
instead trapped his soul inside scrolls of the Black Master. Too late though,
did this generation's warriors discover that it was he who was in the black 
scrolls, for now he has been released.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some

sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Cardo Maximus
  As you enter the city gates, you notice some of the beauty and luxury
Pompeii offers.  Under your feet, the street is paved with smooth limestone,
and elaborately constructed buildings are all around.  To the west, you see
a sign on a door.  To the north, the city waits to be explored.  Bronze
oil lanterns in each doorway light the street and allow the spectacular
murals on the walls to be seen.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

Throne room of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom
  The Castle of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom is surprisingly small, but very nicely
kept. It appears to be the oldest castle in the land, and judging by the name
of the kingdom, has been in existence for perhaps 30 generations. The king 
looks with disdain upon the upstart tzars of the neighboring lands. They 
stole most of the lands of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom several hundred years 
ago, and although weakened, the King remains prideful.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Pasture (2046)

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

s
Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
( 3) A yummy-looking vegetable is growing here.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A normal-looking cow is here, mooing happily.
(Golden Aura) A farmer is working on the fields of the Emperor.
(Golden Aura) A farmer is working on the fields of the Emperor.

1822/2389 HP  1274/2983 MP  2069/2070 mv  1000tnl  
Lv 104  G 2107812 | Pasture (NESW)
>>    
s
Grassy Field
  The fields of Conadrain surround you.  Conadrain derives much of its
wealth from the nutrient rich soil within its lands.  They are careful
however to preserve these nutrients and have developed a system to maximize
the use while not destroying the environment.  Many bandits have tried to
steal from these fields, however they always seem to get caught.  It is
rumored that there is a beautiful apple orchard around here somewhere.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A farmer is working on the fields of the Emperor.
(Golden Aura) A bull is looking at you.

Grassy Field
  The fields of Conadrain surround you.  Conadrain derives much of its
wealth from the nutrient rich soil within its lands.  They are careful
however to preserve these nutrients and have developed a system to maximize
the use while not destroying the environment.  Many bandits have tried to
steal from these fields, however they always seem to get caught.  It is
rumored that there is a beautiful apple orchard around here somewhere.

Grassy Field
  The fields are dotted with various farmhouses.  These farmhouses are run
by state-hired workers.  These people are trained in the general running of
farmland, as well as breeding.  One of the things that has made the
Conadrain economy shoot up is the excellent products which their highly
advanced breeding program has produced.  Many of the farmers live out here,
though the majority still live in some nearby town.  The rare opportunity of
getting your own farmhouse is only given to the smartest and best farmers in
the employment of the Empire.

>>    Field
  The sheer immensity of the fields, has created hundreds upon hundreds of
jobs for the peasants.  They don't earn a great deal, however the job is
fairly popular for you get a small part of the harvest every year.  This
concession was made when the only way they could get people to work the
fields was to conscript the lowest of peasants.  Everyone knows that a hired
hand works better than a person forced to work.

climb ladder

You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

s
Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Grassy Field
  The fields of Conadrain surround you.  Conadrain derives much of its
wealth from the nutrient rich soil within its lands.  They are careful
however to preserve these nutrients and have developed a system to maximize
the use while not destroying the environment.  Many bandits have tried to
steal from these fields, however they always seem to get caught.  It is
rumored that there is a beautiful apple orchard around here somewhere.

As the maid walks down the path, you begin to see the palace.
The wonderful design captivates you as you get closer.
The guards stop the maid temporarily, then open the door and step aside.
She leaves as you enter the main hall, off to do some work.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries. 

[ Exits: north (south) ]
(Red Aura) An officer of the Talsanian Army is waiting to speak with the Emperor.
(Red Aura) An officer of the Talsanian Army is waiting to speak with the Emperor.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

n
Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Entrance to the Training Grounds
  This courtyard seems to have a different emphasis on it compared

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Ascension Bluff (2064)

A Somber Walkway (G)
  After ascending a stairway of clouds leading into the heavens, an individual 
would probably expect to find something surreal at the top. Many an explorer 
has been left disappointed, however, since this is nothing more than the 
Ascension Bluff Nursing Home. The architect thought that a stairway of clouds
would make the residents feel closer to the gods. Unfortunately, all this 
served to do was make this location less suitable for visitors and employees 
to frequent. Further to this, when one closely inspects the clouds, they will
come to the realization that they are not real clouds at all, but rather 
millions of tiny cotton balls affixed to a steel frame. Interestingly enough,
it seems that a nursing home in the clouds acquires quite the eclectic bunch 
of residents. Anyone who chances by a for a visit will find that this nursing
home contains more than just your ordinary sampling of senior citizens.

[ Exits: north down ]
A witch is here, snooping around for spell components.
(Red Aura) A little owl is resting on its perch.
(Red Aura) A death coach stands here, terrifyingly silent and still.

an opening can be seen.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Ascension Bluff (2025)

A Somber Walkway (G)
  After ascending a stairway of clouds leading into the heavens, an individual 
would probably expect to find something surreal at the top. Many an explorer 
has been left disappointed, however, since this is nothing more than the 
Ascension Bluff Nursing Home. The architect thought that a stairway of clouds
would make the residents feel closer to the gods. Unfortunately, all this 
served to do was make this location less suitable for visitors and employees 
to frequent. Further to this, when one closely inspects the clouds, they will
come to the realization that they are not real clouds at all, but rather 
millions of tiny cotton balls affixed to a steel frame. Interestingly enough,
it seems that a nursing home in the clouds acquires quite the eclectic bunch 
of residents. Anyone who chances by a for a visit will find that this nursing
home contains more than just your ordinary sampling of senior citizens.

[ Exits: north down ]
(Red Aura) This carnivorous plant is ready to chomp some flesh!

A Somber Walkway (2070)

A Somber Walkway (2070)

Entrance to Ascension Bluff
  At the entrance to the Ascension Bluff Nursing home the pathway widens into a
semi-circle of flagstones that are surrounded by several stout wooden 
benches. A low-set stone wall hugs all of these particulars, and three wide, 
curved steps lead up to the front entrance of the nursing home. This nursing 
home has been made to look like a lodge in hopes that the residents will feel
like they are simply here on vacation. The roof has a steep slope and the 
exterior of the building has been carefully crafted from wooden logs. Patio 
doors lead straight out to the front gardens and walkway from many locations 
along the front of the building. Even more light is brought into the nursing 
home via expansive, arched windows that take up much of the wall-space above
the patio doors.

[ Exits: (north) south ]

The Conservatory (2066)

The Conservatory (2065)

A butterfly delicately lands on the edge of the bench.
The Conservatory
  This section of the conservatory has a small bench to sit on in order to 
enjoy watching the waterfall to the north. Bright blue and purple butterflies
flutter through the air here and are quite beautiful to watch. There is a 
hardwood walkway and the trees that grow along it reach up tall, nearly to 
the roof.

[ Exits: north east (south) west ]

2389/2389 HP  2972/2983 MP  2064/2070 mv  978tnl  
Lv 104  G 2222454 | The Conservatory (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Laundry Room
  This is a very simple laundry room. The soiled linens and clothes go into one
basket, and there are several other baskets for the neatly folded, clean 
items. A large sink is available in the far corner of the room, just in case 
anything needs to be quickly hand-washed there. Generally, soiled items wait 
for the laundry sorcerer to come and clean them with his spells, unless they 
smell especially pungent. There is only one laundry sorcerer for all of the 
different buildings that hire one in the area, so he usually only swings by 
once a week. This is why anyone would want to do a quick, cursory clean of a 
ridiculously stinky item.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Goat Skull Gate (G) [**> PK <**]
  There is a large iron gate here, with a short elf guarding it.  The gate
is going north into a mountain. There appears to be a cave north of here,
but you can't see through the gate very well.  There are many different
rocks embedded in the mountain.  It almost seems that they form a pattern.
You can hear the dripping of water from inside the caves.
There is also a cold draft of air hitting you.  Perhaps this is the
entrance to the legendary Dark Elf Fortress?

Smaug's Cave (G)
  This huge cave once belonged to the great dragon Smaug, but when the dark
elfs killed Smaug they made this to a large guard cave, animated the corpse
of Smaug and placed him here to guard the fortress.  The smell of death
makes you feel sick.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Pass
  At the southwestern edge of the Halo Mountains lies the entrance to Dusk 
Valley.  The pass is fifteen feet wide and half a mile long.  Cliffs on both 
sides shoot up hundreds of feet.  The wind at the entrance of the pass screams 
through.  Small boulders and rocks continuously fall from above and explode 
upon impacting the ground.  The ground is made up of rock, dust, sand, and 
crushed up bones.  Near the end the pass where the cliffs end the ground 
transitions to a rich farmable soil.  

[ Exits: north south ]

n
Into the Dusk
  The cliffs of the Halo Mountains suddenly end at the edge of Dusk Valley.  
Stories tell of ancient arcane battles within these lands.  The rich, farmable 
soil along the road is damp and contains many varieties of bones from many 
different animals and races.  There is a fine steamy mist throughout the valley 
that dims out the sun during the day.  Shadows move about the mist and there 
are low moans in the distance.  The main road that runs north and south 
through the valley is perfectly constructed with glowing slate in an archaic 
printbone pattern.  Along the outside of the road many radiant globes float 
motionless above. 

[ Exits: north south ]

2389/2389 HP  2493/2983 MP  2067/2070 mv  978tnl  
Lv 104  G 2230388 | Into the Dusk (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Crepuscular
  The archaic printbone pattern in the glowing slate road ends abruptly.  A 
complex radial brick pattern outlines the southeast border of the large town 
square.  The bricks are made of some type of sandstone and give off a very 
different aura.  The atmosphere closely resembles a solar eclipse.  Numerous 
varieties of plants are able to grow in the valley due to the partial sunlight 
and the moist, rich soil.  Spherical objects magically appear and disappear 
through the steamy mist.  Cloaked Eldars move about on and off the road.  Their 
faces are hidden and unrecognizable except for their eyes and most of them 
carry staves made of bones.

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A piece of sandstone lies here.
An Eldar farmer shuffles his feet.
A mist demon blends into a light mist.

Half-Light
  The southwestern edge of the town square is defined by the radial pattern 
of sandstone bricks that are carefully embedded into the ground.  Winged
creatures hover overhead and their bodies appear distorted.  The light from 
the sun amounts to about half of its potential due to the haze.  Cloaked 
Eldars with fixed eyes are busy buying and selling items while they rapidly 
move in and out of the mist.  The ancient Eldar language they speak drones on 
like a chant. 

[ Exits: north east west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A farmer's pitchfork looks sharp.
An Eldar citizen wants to protect his lands.
(Golden Aura) A Relyk scout studies footprints and tracks on the ground.

2389/2389 HP  2493/2983 MP  2066/2070 mv  978tnl  
Lv 104  G 2230388 | Half-Light (NEW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grindstone
  The Grindstone has a stone foundation that supports the wooden walls and 
ceiling.  The stones have been brought into town from the cliffs of Halo 
Mountains, and the lumber from the forestry in the valley.  The blacksmith 
has built all of his own tools and weapons by hand.  A blaze burns in the 
blacksmith's forge near the rear of the building.  A large anvil sits on 
a pillar next to the forge, and a hammer lies on top.  Metal chains hang 
from rafters up above.  A tub of water is near the door that contains silver, 
iron, gold, and copper.

[ Exits: east ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Eventide
  The sandstone brick pattern outlines the northeast border of the town 
square.  There are no visible shops through the mist but the cloaked Eldars
trade objects and materials inconspicuously in small groups.  The figures 
constantly mumble a strange language under their breaths.  Some of the cloaked 
figures sell exquisite lockboxes that are decorated with all types of rubies 
and other gems.  The buyers and sellers appear to complete their sales and then 
quickly step back into the anonymity provided by the mist.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Shades of Silence
  Through the haze is the northwest boundary of the town square.  The sandstone 
bricks provide much needed light and intensive heat radiates upwards.  Cloaked 
Eldars rush by in a hurry to buy and sell goods.  Gold coins occasionally fall 
on the ground but are quickly snatched up.  Strange livestock strolls through 
the town square and fades into the mist.  A peculiar shadow is cast from no

The Dread
  Northwest of the town square, the glowing slate road begins again.  Each 
piece of slate has been perfectly set into place and the design of the stones 
is the traditional archaic Eldar printbone pattern.  The aura of the glowing 
stones provides the only light.  The haze is so thick that you lose all depth 
perception.  Shadows and figures run by on all sides but no distinct figures 
can be made out.  The sound of large wings comes from above. 

[ Exits: south west ]

The Dim
  The glowing slate road runs north, east, and west.  There is minimal haze in 
the air, but fog obscures the road far to the east.  The light remains dim 
despite the relatively thin haze.  To the west stands a tall building.  A 
mysterious unseen energy resides here.  Some of the slate stones have been 
yanked loose from the road and the grasses on the side of the road lean 
northward.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Vallum and the Bind
  The store is literally piled to the ceiling with scrolls and books.  The 
walls are completely lined with shelves and every nook and cranny has been 
filled.  Every type of goatskin, parchment, manuscript, and anything else 
that can be written on might be found here.  The store is mostly a library, 
so only a few items are for sale.  A wide desk sits in the center of the room 
with a stack of rolled-up scrolls on it.  Next to the scrolls is a collection 
of different seals and candles.  The room smells of ink, preserved animal 
skins, and pipe smoke.

force.  Dust, soil, stones, and other small materials fly by at rapid speeds.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
In The Grip
  A massive energy is at work, pulling everything towards a stone obelisk.  
Large boulders, vegetation, animals, and anything else not embedded into the 
ground gets sucked up.  All objects that make contact with the obelisk are 
immediately crushed down into bits.  The strange force constantly rumbles and 
makes the ground shake.  Large faults have opened up where the road used to be.
Dust storms come from every direction and carry with them a very fine, gritty 
sand.  Most light from above is snuffed out from the dust storms, but the 
obelisk shines brilliantly.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

The Pull
  
The dirt road runs north and east. A strong energy pulls everything toward
the east. Giant boulders roll across the road. Vegetation is sucked out of 
the ground and a dust storm is created from the materials of the dirt road.
Light from the sky is dimmed from the amount of debris in the atmosphere 
caused by the energy.

Last Phase
  The strength of the energy from the south east is very weak here and 
hardly any of the vegetation on the sides of the road has been yanked out 
of the ground.  The energy from the southeast sucks only a minimal amount 
of debris into the air in this area.  The light in the atmosphere has a 
unique twilight effect, a combination of the light produced at dusk and 
dawn.

The Pull
  
The dirt road runs north and east. A strong energy pulls everything toward
the east. Giant boulders roll across the road. Vegetation is sucked out of 
the ground and a dust storm is created from the materials of the dirt road.
Light from the sky is dimmed from the amount of debris in the atmosphere 
caused by the energy.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
In The Grip
  A massive energy is at work, pulling everything towards a stone obelisk.  
Large boulders, vegetation, animals, and anything else not embedded into the 
ground gets sucked up.  All objects that make contact with the obelisk are 
immediately crushed down into bits.  The strange force constantly rumbles and 
makes the ground shake.  Large faults have opened up where the road used to be.
Dust storms come from every direction and carry with them a very fine, gritty 
sand.  Most light from above is snuffed out from the dust storms, but the 
obelisk shines brilliantly.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A silver mace is here.
(Golden Aura) A Giant master barbarian stands hard and fast.
(Red Aura) An Eldar master hunter moves in and out of shadows.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) An apprentice navigator stands motionless and stares.
(Golden Aura) An apprentice sorcerer readies his magick.
(Golden Aura) A Giant soldier paces back and forth.
A stone obelisk sucks up matter and crushes it.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Golden Egg
  The lobby of The Golden Egg is known for its comfort and hospitality.  The
Golden Egg stands as the only inn throughout the entire Dusk Valley.  The
room is filled with vibrant colors from floor to ceiling.  Famous Eldar
leaders are immortalized in paintings that hang on the wall just above
handsome inscriptions bearing their names.  The frames of the portraits 
are handcrafted and decorated with gold inlay.  Leather couches and
recliners are arranged around a fireplace on the west wall near a small
library.  A display table has been set up with a full buffet in the
southwest corner.  The owner stands behind the check-in counter which also
happens to be a full bar.  You can just see the owner's eyes within the
hood of his cloak.  Tall leather bar stools line the entire bar.  A large
variety of bottled beverages are neatly placed on shelves behind the
counter.   

[ Exits: east south ]
The innkeeper's servant keeps hard at work.
The innkeeper welcomes you to The Golden Egg.
The innkeeper's son mimics his father's movements.
The innkeeper says, 'Someone needs to take control of The Great Totem.'
The innkeeper says, 'If you think you can, say 'yes'.'

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

help shard of ice
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Shard of Ice'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Cone of Cold.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-26 14:27:33.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'shard of ice' <victim>
Damage: cold
Spell Number: 352

At first invocation, this spell creates a spear of ice that the mage hurls at
their opponents. As it flies through the air, it splinters into a hundred
jagged shards, that impale the enemy upon their freezing spikes. 

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

n
The dark cave
  Entering the dark cave, an overwhelming feeling of dread and despair fills 
your being. Smells of rotten decay waft up from below with sounds that pierce
your being and make the hairs on your neck stand on end. You wonder if this 
adventure is really worth the rewards after hearing tales in the village 
about an eight-armed skeleton who stole a woman only two days ago. Maybe it 
was just the peasant's imagination working during the excitement of the 
moment. Looking around to make sure it's safe to go down, you notice 
something scrawled on the wall.

[ Exits: south down ]

2056/2389 HP  1856/2983 MP  2069/2070 mv  978tnl  
Lv 104  G 2243185 | The dark cave (SD)
>>    
d
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Dropping down through the hole above you, you find yourself standing in a 
twisting passageway of stone. Red eyes glowing in the darkness gleam at you 
and the shuffling sounds of something moving nearer reaches your ears.
Quickly lighting a torch you hold it up, gasping with fear as you take a step
back as undead move forward. So many of them, so many different kinds, your 
mind races... How can this be that they are all working together like this?
Your question will have to wait...

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Entry Foyer
  This room has a pleasant, clean atmosphere.  The carpet is lush and
thick, soothing to weary feet.  Once, perfect nature murals covered the
walls, but now they are singed in spots and their beauty is marred.  Flowers
are dotted about the room, preserved by the unconquerable magic deep within
the foundations...

double-high capacious bed, piled high with colorful blankets and pillows.

festivals.  A window lets in natural light, and the comforting magic light
present everywhere else is stronger here, seeming to have healing and
regenerating properties...  The door through which you entered is the only
way out.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

Shallow Water
  The sea is sloping downwards very slowly.  It is the ideal spot for kids
to play in the water as they will be able to touch the bottom at all times. 
The waves are small and gently roll onto the beach.  A school of tiny fish
swims by at a distance.  The water is lukewarm from the sun.

Shallow Water

direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

>>    
Sun Warmed Beach
  The sand of the sun-warmed beach has footprints that lead in various
directions.  Some of the footprints have been filled with water, some washed
away by the waves.  Various sea shells adorn the sand as if they were placed
there by magic, when in reality, the waves left behind some small treasures
for children to find.  The view of the ocean to the south and west is
breathtakingly beautiful.  The salty sea air is filled with the sound of
hungry seagulls and laughing children.  

[ Exits: north east south ]

e
The Sand Castle
  A large sand castle has been built along the edge of the ocean.  A deep
moat has been placed around it to help protect it from the waves.  The
castle stands about three feet tall and has a roof adorned with beautiful
sea shells.  Although the moat is full and the waves are beginning to lap
against the castle's walls, the castle stands sturdily against the rising
tide.

Writings On The Beach
  Someone has been writing in the sand along the beach.  Although the waves
have washed most of it away, parts of it are still able to be read.  The
letters appear to have been written with a pointy stick, but may have been
written with the blade of a dagger.  The writing doesn't make much sense
considering the waves destroyed the biggest part of it.  To the west is a
small pier.

774/2428 HP  411/3016 MP  2082/2088 mv  878tnl  
Lv 105  G 2266481 | Writings On The Beach (NESW)
>>    The Pier (G)
  The pier is where many people come to fish.  It extends quite a way into
the water, making fishing for large fish easier.  It has some loose boards
here and there and some spots are in need of repair badly.  A large sign has
been posted on part of the pier, but most people ignore it.  The sun beats
down upon the pier making it a good spot to sunbathe and relax.  Many people
walk along the large pier daily.

>>    The Embankment

center are packed with people who appear very small.  To the east lies the
mansion.  It appears heavily guarded.

The Embankment

embankment was made when the island was purchased from Ivar Industries to
keep the high tides from destroying the developments of the island.  The

storms.  The embankment was built around the whole island, leaving very
little of the beach accessible.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

but it has now been swept and turned into a training

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Uncharted Oceans (2003)

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

The Rock On The Beach (2080)

The Moist Beach
  The ocean lies to the west.  A soft breeze is blowing in from that
direction, carrying a salty taste with it.  Sand stretches to the east,
moved by the wind.  To the far north an embankment lies, protecting the
island from the ocean.  The sand here is moist, leaving all the various
footprints clearly visible.  

[ Exits: north east ]

The Rock On The Beach
  A big black rock lies on the sand here.  It is very smooth, not a single
sharp edge can be found.  The top is flat, sloping slightly.  It is large
enough for several children to lie down on.  The sand around it is very fine
and soft.  Seashells are scattered about, unfortunately most are broken.

The Moist Beach
  The ocean lies to the west.  A soft breeze is blowing in from that
direction, carrying a salty taste with it.  Sand stretches to the east,
moved by the wind.  To the far north an embankment lies, protecting the
island from the ocean.  The sand here is moist, leaving all the various
footprints clearly visible.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Walk of the Stars - Requiem
  This path through the stars seems to have been formed by magic from the
music of an imperial dirge.  The terrifying power of this song, played
whenever those who control the metallic moon go into battle, resonates not
with sadness for those lost, but with the reminder of the doom which awaits
any who oppose them.  This terrifying path winds a circle past Bunda, down
to Deneb and Gianfar, west between Chort and Spica, turning north near
Corona Aerianni, then east, meandering between Nasil and Zacuto to complete
its circuit.  Gianfar lies southeast of here, Deneb and Zaniah to the
southwest, while Absolvo Te is directly east from here, across the Antipodal
Celestial Meridian.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Ancient Reman Road (2058)

A Twisted and Cracked Ancient Road
  Lone and bare, the level sands stretch and twist to the edges of
vision.  Like slow ocean breakers they crash against the rocky shores of
this desert sea.  Ancient bleached bones sit like shipwrecks high upon the
rocks that thrust through the sandy waves, beckoning like sirens of old
those weary travellers to their thirsty doom.  A cracked and ancient road
rides through the wastes like a bridge over a troubled sea, twisting on
motionless waves of sand until it disappears into the haze of the east.  
A small weather beaten and blasted marker sits half buried by the all
encompassing sands.  Its barely legible words state '20 miles to Reme.'

A Carefully Maintained Road (2079)

Well Travelled Crossroads
  The road you have been following through the desert has arrived at a
great intersection, carved from the rock and the sands that seem to make up
most of this place.  A rusting iron cage hangs forlornly from a graying
wooden pole, squeaking in the harsh acid wind that blows across the sandy
wastes about you.  A few sullen vultures sit upon the pole, regarding you
strangely as you peer into the rusting iron of the cage and notice bleached
bones and rags that tell of past meals for these scavengers of the sky. 
Sand blasted expanses of road lead off in all directions, and along the one
to your east you can see the hazy spires of a mighty city thrusting upwards
from its sandy base.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Road Ending at a Mine Shaft
  Dry shrubs blow in the slow wind, in ruts left by long ago wagons.  A
thousand feet in marching rhythm have pounded the soil into a fine mist of
white dry dust, blanketing all it touches, while the remnants of tracks tell
well the story of mining sledges carrying ore to nearby Reme.  Precious is
that ore, the lifeblood of Reme, paid for in miner's lives and sweat, deep
below these sandy hills.  All gone now, as the shattered shells of soldiers
at your feet tell well.  Reme marches once more to war, and these poor souls
have honoured well their covenant to Emperor and city.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Entrance to the Silver Mines
  This dark chamber, carved into the still living rock of this desert
hill, is crudely worked and shored.  Still, the great oaken beams that line
the walls and ceiling give both the impression of great strength and age. 
This mine was built to last the years well indeed, and you might think it
working still if it were not for the bodies littering the floor, and the
dark magical orbs that once gave light into this dark chamber.  A shaft
leads downwards into the depths of the earth, barred and locked with great
bands of silver and iron.

Entrance to the Silver Mines
  This dark chamber, carved into the still living rock of this desert
hill, is crudely worked and shored.  Still, the great oaken beams that line
the walls and ceiling give both the impression of great strength and age. 
This mine was built to last the years well indeed, and you might think it
working still if it were not for the bodies littering the floor, and the
dark magical orbs that once gave light into this dark chamber.  A shaft
leads downwards into the depths of the earth, barred and locked with great
bands of silver and iron.

[ Exits: south (down) ]
     A mysterious looking key lies here. You wonder what it goes to...
A seagull pecks at a dead fish.

d
Mine Shaft
  The vertical shaft above you turns at an angle here, running towards
the north.  The rough wooden planking of the stairs has given way to a
smoother stone floor, still marked by miners' tools and footsteps.  The
walls are damp, with beads of moisture glistening in your lantern's light. 
Clearly neither the magical lights or ventilation systems are working. 
Either those lurking down here lack the ability to maintain them or they
have their reasons for preferring the dark.
