Mine Tunnel
  The tunnel runs in a straight line here, cutting well into the
darkness of the shaft, following an ancient seam of dark black ore that
still can be glimpsed in clumps present in the walls about you.  Flimsy
wooden pilings hold the ceiling at bay, and you begin to truly realize the
weight of earth they have to support.  You hurry down the tunnel, afraid of
this dark and oppressive place.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Mine Tunnel
  You can see more clearly now that that faint gleaming light you

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside a Natural Cave
  You stand now in the shadows at a slight twist in the tunnel.  To your
west through a curtain of smoke you can see a large crack in the stone,
which seems both artificial and natural at the same time.  Perhaps some
miner cutting through the seams of ore struck a blow which caved in this
crack, leading him or her into a small natural cave formerly buried deep
within the rock.  Clearly something has discovered this cave also, and has
used it as a sort of camp or guardpost.  Sleeping figures can be seen around
a bonfire, and the glints of weapons at their sides tells well their
intentions.  You hold your weapon tightly as you sneak inside.

[ Exits: east west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* In a Natural Cave
  The bonfire flickers in the small cave, casting odd shadows along the
uneven walls and pillars of this natural cave.  A small stream provides
water and cooling air to the campers now sleeping here, and a sandy floor
provides a softer spot than the rock outside to sleep.  The weapons though
tell you that though these men and women might appreciate their comforts,
they still know well the ways of war.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A Well-Lit Mine Tunnel
  This tunnel section is lit brightly by smokey pitch-burning torches. 
You can see that they were recently set into the walls, in roughly carved
wooden holders thrust into chiseled holes in the stone.  You can hear
movement ahead of you, to your north, and almost see something shifting
slowly through the hazy musty air.  Fear makes your blood run cold are you
realize how alien this place is to you, and how deep within the earth you
have come. 

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A blood-crazed rebel glares at you!
(Red Aura) A blood-crazed rebel glares at you!

2428/2428 HP  2416/3016 MP  2082/2088 mv  476tnl  
Lv 105  G 2222037 | A Well-Lit Mine Tunnel (NS)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Outside a Large Open Space
  Slipping from shadow to shadow underneath the dim light of the flickering 
torches, you watch the gladiators in the camp ahead. One grotesquely scarred 
man holds a wooden practice sword, breathing harshly from bruised lips as he 
attempts with all his strength to bash another man in the head. Two more 
gladiators sit morosely around a fire, half heartedly glaring at the 
passers-by around them as they sharpen and oil their weapons against the damp
air down here. Ragged though their skin and clothes might be, still their 
steel holds well its edge, and their will holds great power. You grip the 
hilt of your weapon firmly as you prepare to stride into their midst.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A blood-crazed rebel glares at you!

2428/2428 HP  2416/3016 MP  2079/2088 mv  476tnl  
Lv 105  G 2222037 | Outside a Large Open Space (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A Large Natural Cavern
  Hot stinking air rises around you, stirring the flames of small bonfires that
litter the sandy floor of this subterrean campsite. The scarred eyes and ears
of those gladiators who inhabit this space follow you none too gently, 
accusing and challenging with their glare. Only the uncertainty of who you 
are and how you got past their sentries seems to hold them in check. Clearly 
they fear you might be someone of importance, and while they would not 
respect you for this, they would indeed fear the retribution of their leader 
should a guest of his be found 'discomfited' here. To your north a larger 
bonfire can be seen.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A blood-crazed rebel glares at you!
(Golden Aura) A reman official strides by.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A Rough Campsite Underground
  The camp is larger here, with dozens of gladiators in their ragged
armor and clothes scattered about a small iron cookpot.  Weapons litter the
sandy soil here, stacked in readiness for a call to arms by their leader,
and grisly trophies tell you well indeed that these weapons have been well
used in recent times.  You walk past them with great care, trying to seem
unconcerned, lest they fall upon you as mad dogs upon a scared deer.  You
stumble northwards, towards a brightly lit section of the cave.

2428/2428 HP  2416/3016 MP  2073/2088 mv  476tnl  
Lv 105  G 2222037 | A Rough Campsite Underground (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A Roughly Made Throneroom
  You stand in the middle of a richly decorated part of the cavern.  Rich
rugs and silken tapestries have been hung from the stalagtites of the cave,
reminding you of legends of Ali Baba and his treasure caves.  Sparkling
spires of stone have been rudely hacked into torch holders, and a great
crystal block in the center of the cave, once of great wonder and beauty,
has been smashed and dragged away to leave room for a crude wooden throne. 
The throne has had attached to its arms two skulls, with flesh still
clinging to their pitiful bones.  You begin to suspect that two more Reman
officers will not be reporting back to barracks tonight.  A small crack in
the cave wall leads to your east, and the cave opens up back to your south. 

[ Exits: east south ]
     A roughly hewn wooden throne sits upon the floor here.

s
A Rough Campsite Underground
  The camp is larger here, with dozens of gladiators in their ragged
armor and clothes scattered about a small iron cookpot.  Weapons litter the
sandy soil here, stacked in readiness for a call to arms by their leader,
and grisly trophies tell you well indeed that these weapons have been well
used in recent times.  You walk past them with great care, trying to seem
unconcerned, lest they fall upon you as mad dogs upon a scared deer.  You
stumble northwards, towards a brightly lit section of the cave.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
